name: Neer More (South Indian-Style Spiced Buttermilk)
description: A slightly spicy, grassy palate cleanser popular in South India for its cooling properties, this drink is just the thing to get you back on your feet after a heavy meal.
recipeYield: makes 2 1/2 cups, 2 large or 4 small servings
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons lemon juice from 1 to 2 lemons
1/2 fresh jalapeno, seeded and minced (about 2 teaspoons)
1/2 cup fresh cilantro leaves, roughly chopped
1 teaspoon yellow or black mustard seeds

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender combine buttermilk, water, lemon juice, ginger, jalapeno, cilantro, asafoetida, and a pinch of salt. Cover and blend on high speed until mixture takes on a greenish tint, about 10 seconds. Taste and adjust for salt, then set aside.

Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium high heat until shimmering. Add mustard seeds and curry leaves, coat with oil, and cook until the mustard seeds begin to crackle and pop, 1 minute or less. Immediately remove from heat and add to blender. Stir mixture together until well combined, then serve immediately.
